etymology.description: semantic: 艹(艹) (cǎo, "grass") + phonetic: 罗(羅) (luó) = type of plant -> vines; radish
etymology.interpretation: The character 萝(蘿) (luó, "vines; radish") integrates the 艹(艹) (cǎo, "grass") radical to signify its relation to plants, while 罗(羅) (luó, "net") provides the phonetic component. Together, they convey the meaning of plant-related entities such as vines or radish.
etymology.simplification: Simplified by replacing the traditional component 羅(羅) (luó, "net") with 罗(羅), maintaining its pronunciation while reducing the complexity of writing.

examples.chinese: 春天来临时(春天來臨時)，菜园里的萝开始发芽(菜園裏的蘿開始發芽)。
examples.pinyin: Chūntiān láilín shí, càiyuán lǐ de luó kāishǐ fāyá.
examples.english: When spring arrives, the radish in the garden begins to sprout.

examples.chinese: 月光下的萝(蘿)，闪着微光(閃著微光)。
examples.pinyin: Yuèguāng xià de luó, shǎn zhe wēiguāng.
examples.english: Under the moonlight, the vine glimmers with a faint light.
